oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Diary of Thomas Jefferson Campbell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1863[-1865] pocket diary of Jeff Campbell (1837-1902), Co. A, 6th Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA. It begins January 1 at Nashville, where he can hear the action at Stones River. Campbell soon records a visit from Gen. William Rosecrans, "a pleasant looking man," and later tells of a hanging execution. On September [November?] 21-23, Campbell writes, "The Battel was going on [and] we are ordered to the front…. We are on lookout mout [sic] the rebels are all around us we think that we will be routed."
